alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 21 at 2:50PM PDT until August 21 at 8:15PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues within and adjacent to creeks, streams that are coming out of the southern Sierra, Inyo and White Mountains, and within the Owens Valley. * WHERE...Portions of southeast California and southern California, including the following counties, in southeast California, Inyo. In southern California, San Bernardino. * WHEN...Until 900 PM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 247 PM PDT, gauge reports indicate runoff from last night heavy rain in creeks and streams continues to flow at above normal levels but will continue to gradually decrease into the evening hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bishop, Lone Pine, Independence, Olancha, Big Pine, South Lake, Aspendell, Portagee Lake Campground, Diaz Lake, Tuttle Creek Campground, Whitney Portal Campground, Keeler, Independence Creek Campground, Cartago, Oak Creek Campground, Onion Valley Campground, Sawmill Creek Campground, Goodale Creek Campground, Taboose Creek Campground and Tinemaha Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
